bibl.title: J.W. Tripp v. Territory of Washington. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Jefferson County Third Judicial District Court

body.p: For return to the within writ, I John H. Woodly Sheriff of Jefferson County W.T. state under oath that I have the within names defendant J.W. Tripp in custody, as Sheriff aforesaid, by virtue of a commitment issued to me by W.L. Chalmers Justice of the Peace in and for the County aforesaid at Port Townsend, on the charge of killing one Alexander Clarke, at said Port Townsend, on the 16th day of May A.D. 1867, which said commitment is in writing and dated and issued the 18th day of May as 1864. and produce the said J.W. Tripp in accordance with the command of the within writ and annex hereto a copy of said commitment.
Sworn and subscribed before me this 4 day of June A.D. 1867
In the matter of the application of _____
for a WRIT of HABEAS CORPUS. WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS Filed June 4, 1867 James Seavey DeputyClerk.
On a full hearing of this case I find no cause for disturbing the action of the magestrate + so order the defendant remanded into custody as before as on said commitment
